thread.title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus' son joins Northwestern basketball team as walk-on
thread.title_full: Julia Louis-Dreyfus' son joins Northwestern basketball team as walk-on - Chicago Tribune

author: Tracy Swartz
title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus' son joins Northwestern basketball team as walk-on
text:
Get out! Julia Louis-Dreyfus' youngest son has joined Northwestern University's basketball team as a walk-on, a university representative announced this week.
"So proud of our boy," Louis-Dreyfus tweeted Wednesday night . "Yes, he got the height from me."
Freshman Charlie Hall, 18, is 6 feet, 5 inches tall and weighs 205 pounds, according to his Northwestern athletic profile . He averaged 15.3 points, 11 rebounds and five assists per game during his final season at his Santa Monica high school, according to nusports.com .
On Wednesday, Northwestern Associate Director of Athletic Communications Nick Brilowski announced on Twitter that Hall had joined the team.
"Welcome to new @NUMensBball walk-on Charlie Hall. Yada, yada, yadaâ€¦you might know his mother," Brilowski tweeted. The Northwestern basketball team, which went 15-17 last season, kicks off its season in November .
Louis-Dreyfus and her husband, Brad Hall, met while attending Northwestern. She received an honorary doctor of arts degree in 2007 .
Northwestern basketball walk-on Charles Hall, son of Julia Louis-Dreyfus, is just one of several athletes with a famous parent. Many are football players currently on rosters.
The fifth season of her show "Veep" is slated to premiere next year .
 Basketball
